post_text: The Ontario Middle School football team partnered with Hope for Every Heart Ministries, a nonprofit organization dedicated to giving hope to villages in Africa, to help a family in Uganda. The players earned money from doing chores and other activities to provide a donation of $1,000 to provide a widow and her children shelter and bedding. The family now has a home and the boys learned a valuable lesson in the importance of charity. Way to go, Warriors! ğŸ’›ğŸ’™ #TheWarriorWay

Thank you for your patience and understanding as we worked on a plan for the 2020-2021 school year. We are extremely excited to be able to welcome our students and staff members back! The reopening plan and a letter to families were shared today via email. They can also be found online:

â­ Reopening Plan â¡ï¸ https://tinyurl.com/y8abrj23
â­ Family Letter â¡ï¸ https://tinyurl.com/y77paxo7

If you have any questions regarding the upcoming school year, please contact Superintendent Lisa Carmichael at carmichael.lisa@olsohio.org or Director of Education Mike Ream at ream.mike@olsohio.org. #TheWarriorWay

Today Thursday, July 2, Governor DeWine announced back to school health and safety guidelines for all school districts across Ohio. Ontario Local Schools is currently reviewing those guidelines.

Our school district has been planning and preparing for multiple scenarios to safely welcome students and staff back.

We will be reviewing the latest information from the governor so we can meet the requirements set forth in these guidelines. Once we know more, we will share more details. #TheWarriorWay

post_text:
**** Special Update ****

Per Governor Mike DeWineâ€™s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue with emergency remote learning for the remainder of the current academic year due to COVID-19.

We know there will be many questions as a result of this announcement; we are working quickly to address those, as well as identify alternative solutions for the impacts of this decision. In the meantime, we appreciate all of you for your ongoing support as we work through this together. #TheWarriorWay #InThisTogetherOhio

post_text:
The #OMSWeeklyChallenge is back! The second weekly activity challenge for Ontario Middle School students is to create a Harptoon. If you are not familiar with Harptoons, you can go to their website (https://www.harptoons.com/what-is-harptoons.html) and see that they are cartoon drawings created by Steve Harpster (a fellow Buckeye)! The Harptoon video section (https://www.harptoons.com/drawing-videos.html) on the website has instructions on how to create your own version of a Harptoon! Have FUN and see what you can doodle. ğŸ–ï¸

When youâ€™ve finished a drawing(s), send a photo of yourself and your drawing to Mrs. Johnson (johnson.m@olsohio.org). If you also share your doodle on your personal social media page, tag #OMSWeeklyChallenge. If the post is public, we can see and share your amazing drawings! #TheWarriorWay #WarriorsKeepOn

Children may be asking more questions like â€œwhatâ€™s going to happen?â€ and as a parent/caregiver, you may be wondering how you can better support your children and focus on the positive.

As a resource, weâ€™re providing this diagram which shows what you control, what you donâ€™t, and how to respond accordingly. As always, our school counselors/social workers are always available for questions or guidance during this time. Weâ€™re all in this together and are here to support you!

post_text: Arguing isnâ€™t something that should happen in a classroom, unless youâ€™re an 8th grade Language Arts student! Recently these students have been working on an argumentative project and it kicked off with each student choosing a different topic to take a position on. Next, students had to research and find two sources to support their claim and one source to support a counterclaim. After writing an argumentative essay, they created a Google Slideshow to present to the class. Many students chose to survey their classmates to collect real world data to include in their presentations. Included in this project, students also created an advertisement trying to persuade their audience to come to their side. They all did an outstanding job arguing their positions! ğŸ—£ï¸#TheWarriorWay

KINDNESS has been spread through hallways, conversations, hearts and books this month at Stingel Elementary as students celebrated Kindness Month. â¤ï¸

Students in Mrs. Leachâ€™s, Mrs. Thomasâ€™, and Mrs. Calhounâ€™s 1st and 2nd grade classes read and learned a lesson from the book ğ‘¬ğ’‚ğ’„ğ’‰ ğ‘²ğ’Šğ’ğ’…ğ’ğ’†ğ’”ğ’”. The lesson started by dropping different sized rocks into a tub of water to show the ripple effect. Over the course of two days they read the book and discussed what the ripple effect was in the book. Next, students were each given a small â¤ï¸to hold as quotes from the book were shared. Teachers then asked students to share how they thought the characters felt in those moments. They concluded by having a discussion on how sometimes we miss out on opportunities to show kindness and how we need to wake up intentionally each day and show kindness to others in simple, ordinary ways. Wow, what an important lesson these teachers shared with their students! #TheWarriorWay
